newsitem.title: USA: Florida neighborhood warned of "bear necessities".
newsitem.headline: Florida neighborhood warned of "bear necessities".

text.p: Orlando suburbanites were deliberately banging their trash can lids and whistling more loudly than usual Wednesday to scare off a wandering bear.
Central Florida wildlife officials said they have had many reports of a 300-pound black bear roaming a section of Orange County just outside Orlando this week.

Mark Byrd said he nearly had his wits scared out of him when he brushed up against the animal inside his darkened greenhouse. "It just grumbled a little," he said, adding that he slowly inched his way outside and telephoned authorities.

Wildlife officials said Florida black bears are not an endangered species and guessed that the animal had come from the woods about five miles away. "A nice day's travel for a bear," Lieut. Joy Hill, a state wildlife officer, said.

She said there was no indication the bear planned to leave the suburbs, which was why wildlife officers were giving residents "technical assistance" including this advice: "Make a lot of noise. Try not to bump into it."

"We've never had a documented case of a bear attacking a human in Florida," she said, adding that if the bear does not wander off on its own wildlife officers would try to capture it and ship it away from the area.
